sub section 1.1: In Q3 2021, GFS reported total revenue of approximately $1.7 billion, representing a QoQ increase of 5% driven by higher wafer shipments and a significant YoY increase of approximately 45%, which was attributed to the ramp in 5G RF front-end modules and increased demand in the smart mobile end market. The revenue results exceeded the guidance provided in Q2 2021 due to stronger than anticipated market demand.

sub section 1.2: GFS shipped approximately 609,000 300mm equivalent wafers in Q3 2021, leading to total wafer revenue accounting for around 92% of the overall revenue. The average selling price (ASP) of wafers showed modest sequential improvements, contributing positively to the revenue stream.

sub section 2.1: GFS reported the following sales by segment in Q3 2021; Automotive sales accounted for 6% of total revenue and grew almost 4x year-over-year, Compute segment sales were 7% of total revenue and declined year-over-year, Communications Infrastructure and Data Center represented 17% and grew over 30% year-over-year, while Home and Industrial IoT accounted for 13% and grew approximately 37% year-over-year.

sub section 2.2: The company has not provided specific forward-looking guidance by segment for Q4 2021 at this stage.
